ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot of Italian vocabular, grammar, etc. Was able to speak Italian and write compositions in Italian. Went from having no knowledge of Italian to being able to give a 7+ minute presentation in Italian.
I developed a greater understanding of both the Italian language and culture.
Basic Italian grammar and vocab skills
how to speak/read/write italian
I learned the basics and key foundational skills to the Italian language.
learned italian
I learned just about every basic aspect of the Italian language. The material was covered well and thoroughly.
Italian skills developed massively from nothing to being able give a 10 minute presentation and have basic conversations as well as developing writing and reading skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Farina is an amazing professor who made classtime fun and engaging. Quizzes and review helped guide us in knowing what we have to study. The tests were very fair and not too demanding. One of the only cons I can think of is the daily homework could be a bit hard to keep up with every week. However, if you collaborate with other classmates it makes the homework a lot more doable. Also it can be hard to reach Farina outside of class.
I liked the asynchronous nature of Fridays. I don't think much can be improved; it's pretty solid as an introduction to the language.

This class was very fun. Michael made learning fun and not stressful. I think the expectation of our performance was unclear most of the time. The material moves very fast and it is easy to fall behind even if you're studying every night.

Strengths: very open classroom
Weaknesses: it felt like we had to teach ourselves at times
Very active learning. Talking Italian the whole time in class is really great for learning. The course could prepare you for the tests slightly better though

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes because Farina is an amazing professor who is very helpful and engaging. This is probably the best foreign language class I have ever taken.
Yes  Michael is a fantastic instructor.
Yes, Italian is a great language to learn at Yale. The department is fun and always has nice events to keep students engaged.
yes, italian culture is great
I would  every language requires a lot of work, and Italian is no different. It's a good class, just be prepared to put in some time.
Yes- great for starting out italian. farina is funny and personable.
Absolutely, I loved professor farina and the class as a whole
Yes I had a great time on this course and constantly speaking Italian in class has led me to make many good friends.
